greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n'' = second arithmetic derivative of n.
comment: a(2p) = 1 for any prime p implies p,p+2 form a twin prime pair. - _Kevin J. Gomez_, Aug 29 2017
link: T. D. Noe and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 2000 terms from T. D. Noe)
Victor Ufnarovski and Bo Åhlander, How to Differentiate a Number, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 6, 2003.
mathematica: dn[0]=0; dn[1]=0; dn[n_]:=Module[{f=Transpose[FactorInteger[n]]}, If[PrimeQ[n], 1, Plus@@(n*f[[2]]/f[[1]])]]; Table[dn[dn[n]], {n, 100}] (T. D. Noe)
f[n_] := If[ Abs@ n < 2, 0, n*Total[#2/#1 & @@@ FactorInteger[Abs@ n]]]; Table[ f[ f[ n]], {n, 81}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 12 2012 *)
xref: Cf. A003415 (arithmetic derivative of n), A099306 (third arithmetic derivative of n).
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 28 2002
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Oct 12 2004
